pullRequest.body:
This refactors instances of the continuous functional calculus slightly. In particular, the derived instances for `IsSelfAdjoint` and `0 â‰¤ Â·` will now trigger automatically once the type class conditions are satisfied, and these are generic, not specific to Câ‹†-algebras. For nonnegative elements, this utilizes the new type class `NonnegSpectrumClass`.

In addition, we show that the restricted continuous functional calculi are equal to their non-restricted counterparts. 

---

- [x] depends on: #11957 
- [x] depends on: #11958

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8599283769/job/23561850142)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8599283769/job/23561849468)

Do we also want `cfc_nnreal_eq_complex` for completeness?

I think not? There is no direct coercion from NNReal to Complex anyway. As for the other direction, you could use nnnorm, but then you make it harder to stop midway in Real. If we use it a lot and it's a pain to go through both lemmas, then we can add a direct one.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: generalize instances of the continuous functional calculus
